quest.name: Burgeoning Dread
journal:
Khloe Bajhiri seeks an adventurer's aid to investigate a promising scoop.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

In recent days, Eorzea finds itself plagued with alarming atmospheric phenomena that have its denizens fearing another coming of the Calamity. As Khloe Bajhiri of Gridania's The Raven tells it, Commander Vorsaile Heuloix insists that it is simply a Garlean diversion, but the savvy reporter is convinced that forces far more sinister are afoot. To answer her earnest plea, seek out proof of the otherworldly nature of the disturbances, that you might secure a scoop worthy of The Raven's front page. Witnesses have sighted the supernatural storms in various locations: south of Fullflower Comb in the East Shroud, south of Camp Tranquil in the South Shroud, southeast of Horizon in western Thanalan, south of Forgotten Springs in southern Thanalan, northeast of the Foremast in middle La Noscea, and south of Costa del Sol in eastern La Noscea.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

After a hard-fought battle, you have emerged with a curious doll that would seem to be conclusive evidence that the Garlean Empire is not behind the disturbances plaguing the Twelveswood. Deliver it to Commander Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest to prove his theory in error, then prepare to report your findings to Khloe Bajhiri.

The otherworldly force behind the disturbances was revealed to be one Shantotto, a formidable sorceress hailing from a distant world. As the mighty mage herself explains it, an oversized golem of her creation went berserk, raining destruction upon the land with no rhyme or reason─though given that the construct's original purpose was to conquer Eorzea in its mistress's name, this could be seen as a fortunate turn of events. Shantotto has returned to her realm, but her rampaging minion remains behind, leaving you and your fellow adventurers to see that it wreaks no further havoc upon the realm.
objectives: Participate in the FATE “Embiggened Spriggans” followed by the FATE “Tower of Power” to obtain proof of the otherworldly menace.
Deliver the doll to Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text: MadamSir! A moment of your time, if you please. I'm Khloe Bajhiri of The Raven: every Gridanian's favorite source─well, their only source, but that's neither here nor there─for the latest tidings from the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text: And you, my adventuring friend, are precisely the womanman I've been looking for to assist me in investigating a scoop of─quite literally─earth-shaking proportions.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text:
Mayhap you have observed some alarming atmospheric phenomena of late? Searing flames raining down from the heavens, blizzards burying mighty oaks in snow and ice, cyclones so fierce as to whisk a pack of goobbues clear off their feet...
Why, those that have borne witness and returned to tell the tale talk as if another Calamity is upon us.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text: Most ominously of all, one witness─a proper half-wit, but I've long since learned not to discount any of my sources─swears to have sighted a towering black demoness at the eye of the storm. He said the bellowing laugh of the “She-Devil”─that's what he called the thing─haunts his dreams ever since.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text: Commander Heuloix, in all his stubbornness, insists that this is all merely a Garlean diversion, but I cannot agree. No, my nose for news tells me that something─or someone─far more sinister is afoot. Something...not of this world.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text:
Why, I'm so certain of this that I've already begun thinking up suitable headlines. “Extradimensional Devastation Portends Eorzea's Ruination!”, “Preternatural Sorcery Wreaking Havoc─Will Our Realm Avert a Fate Most Tragic?”
I am not wont to employ rhyme in my articles, but the unprecedented nature of this story stirs in me a flair for the dramatic.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text: I have compiled eyewitness reports from all across Eorzea─here, I shall jot them down in your journal so you might have an idea of where to begin your search. I implore you, adventurer: find some proof that the disasters are of otherworldly origin, present it to Commander Heuloix for a proper analysis, and return here with a scoop worthy to grace The Raven's front page.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: An otherworldly force of destruction? <sigh> I can tell you only what I have told the others. Without proof that this is more than just an imperial diversion, I will not risk the lives of my men chasing after shadows.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: What have we here? 'Twould appear to be some kind of doll. You retrieved this after felling a towering she-devil at the eye of that sorcerous storm?

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: I have not seen its like before, and yet I am quite confident in saying this is not of Garlean make. Perhaps I was too hasty to dismiss that reporter's presumptions...

dialogue.name: SERPENTPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Seven hells!?

dialogue.name: KIPIHJAKKYA
dialogue.text: G-Gods preserve us!

dialogue.name: SERPENTPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: We have an intruder, Commander!

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: (-???-)O～hohohohohoho!

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: (-???-)Caught unawares by my stunning arrival? Such heedlessness is ill conducive to your continued survival.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: (-???-)Certainly a guest of my repute deserves a more befitting salute?

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
(-???-)I expect to see more than mouths agape, if my wrath you wish to escape.
As a matter of foremost urgency, you might begin by groveling for mercy.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Vorsaile Heuloix of the Order of the Twin Adder does not grovel. And now that I have given you a proper introduction, I daresay you owe us the same courtesy.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: (-???-)Owe? What a funny man. Do you not see your fate rests in the palm of my hand?

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: (-???-)But I shall overlook your insolence, if only this once. After all, I suppose you can't help being a dunce.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Stay your hand. I am not enamored of our visitor's arrogance, yet I would hear her out.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
Your judgment is quite wise─you may yet stave off an untimely demise.
Now heed me well, lest you come to woe─you stand before the illustrious Shantotto!

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: The Federation of Windurst in Vana'diel is my demesne, where I preside as supreme mistress of all matters arcane.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Lofty words. And yet both your name and your homeland are unfamiliar to me. Pray tell, what brings you to Gridania?

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: A full answer would cause your meager minds to unravel. Let us just say that my powers allow for interdimensional travel.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: Sadly, I had to seal away this most marvelous spell, for reasons upon which I'd rather not dwell.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
Anyhow, I recently revisited the incantation, for the purpose of making some ameliorations.
You know how the saying goes: the mind of a genius is never at repose.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Inter...dimensional travel, did you say?

dialogue.name: SERPENTOIC
dialogue.text: C-Commander... I cannot begin to comprehend what our visitor is trying to convey.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: In all honesty, I am not faring much better. 'Twould appear the gist is that her powers are not to be trifled with.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
Why, that's the most astute observation you've made all day. I suggest you quit while things are going your way.
Anyhow, testing the spell, I found myself by chance in your land─and quickly observed that things have gotten out of hand.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
Beast tribes run amok, imperial plotting─the very core of your...Eorzea?...is rotting.
Fortunately, I was at once inspired, with a plan to deliver you from the fate in which you are mired.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: Raze your realm to the ground, leaving nary a shred, then erect an empire of my own in its stead. Yes, the only way to save this dimension...is to bring about a true Shantotto ascension! My golem was assessing the feasibility of this plan, until it came to a grinding halt at this adventurer's hand.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
Fortunately for you, I can forgive and forget. Besides, you've afforded me data that may prove useful yet.
In return for your─albeit unwitting─aid, I'd offer you this creation of mine in trade. But be warned...

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: Should you fail to treat her right, I shall set your pants alight!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOIC
dialogue.text: C-Commander! I daresay this vile witch poses a greater threat to our realm than the beast tribes and the Garleans combined...

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: ...But I've dallied long enough in this dimension. Matters of actual import demand my attention.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: Fear not─should your realm remain in disarray, the esteemed Shantotto shall return to rescue the day.

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, worry not about my wayward creation. In its current state, it could at best overthrow a single nation!

dialogue.name: SHANTOTTO
dialogue.text:
(-Disembodied Voice-)O～hohoho!
Ooo～hohohohohohohohoho!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOIC
dialogue.text: Commander! Should we not pursue her?

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: And how do you propose we do that? No, it is clear that this...Shantotto...is a singular force of destruction the likes of which we cannot hope to contain.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Better that she depart of her own volition, lest that appalling plot of hers come to fru─er, pass.

dialogue.name: KHLOEBAJHIRI
dialogue.text: Who–the what–the where–the why–now? Someone tell me I haven't been sitting on my arse deaf and dumbfounded as the scoop of a lifetime came and went before my eyes!

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: In any event, you've done a great deed for us in getting to the bottom of this mess, Forename. It would seem we've not seen the last of Shantotto's crazed creation, but I trust you will see that it brings no further harm to our realm.
